revised_title: Investigating the Sun's Variable Emission of Light and Heat
tldr: The author, William Herschel, conducted solar observations to investigate the nature of the sun and its variable emission of light and heat. He discovered new terms and phenomena on the sun's surface, such as openings, shallows, ridges, nodules, corrugations, indentations, and pores. These observations helped improve our understanding of the sun's physical construction and its influence on Earth.
